Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has water and light, showing it as healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant without water, showing the plant looking unhealthy or wilted.
The student can draw a plant without light, showing the plant looking unhealthy or not growing.
The student can identify patterns from their drawings that illustrate how plants need both water and light to live and grow.
The student can describe through their drawings that plants in dark environments or without water do not thrive.
